title: What was Michael Jackson's contribution to music? - Quora

response.answer_text: The concept of music videos  used to be simply the singer standing and singing with some background. He introduced to concept of short films i.e. including a complete storyline in a music video.Along with a singer, he was a composer, song writer, producer and a brilliant performer.He fought against racism in the music industry. Earlier, black artists were never give time on TV to show their music videos and hence they never got any promotion. But Michael was so big that without playing his songs the channels never got any viewer-ship. Hence, even the companies which were reluctant to play black artists had to play him on their channel.With Motown 25 he got to a whole new level of audience never recieved before.When MTV started, they had a pretty low business. But when MJ chose to put his music videos on MTV, it rose to fame. The success of MTV rode on Michael Jackson.Street dancers never got the appreciation they deserved. But MJ popularized their moves. He brought the street dance to main stage urban contemporary.He was ahead of his time and new the trends. He started setting touring records in the 80s and 90s. Most of the current tours are basically the replication of his idea. He became the most famous person ever and used his fame to help the people. The composed the song WE ARE THE WORLD for charity which eventually became the highest selling single.Earlier the trend was that when ever the artist got one or two good songs, he would just fill in other songs to complete the Album. MJ was against this idea. He wanted every song on the album to be a hit and the songs should convey the meaning of the title of the album.MJ has the records for best selling albums ever in the history. Thriller is said to have crossed 125 million sales so far. Bad, Dangerous and History are well over 30 million in sales.He made a big music empire of his own. He started with buying Beatles Catalog and then collaborated with Sony to make the biggest music publishing company ever called Sony ATV of which he is 50% owner. The company is said to be worth 5-10 Billion Dollars.Combining his musical genius with the ability to wow the audience and the level of fame he got which helped him rule the music world for more than 4 decades makes him the Greatest of all time.

What Michael Jackson did as an artist to influence music probably suffices to fill multiple books. But let's name the main points.  He was one of the few in his time to be a complete entertainer. He was a songwriter, a great singer and a dancer. His perfectionism is a benchmark used for any dancer even today. The concept of music videos as short films is one of Michael Jackson's greatest accomplishments. You know, the way music videos often have this sort of story they tell? Well, that's thanks to good ol' MJ.In the 80's MJ's "Motown 25" performance and the subsequent sales of Thriller almost singlehandedly kickstarted the music industry, which was getting sorta dusty at the time. MJ made MTV the success it is today, and moreover, through his sheer skill and success, moved it to integrate black music in the channel. He effectively broke through a racial barrier, which has made it possible for pretty much all African-American artists after him to even get on TV.Michael Jackson popularized the Robot, break-dancing and many other dance styles. He also invented a lot of cool moves, although the Moonwalk is not one of them.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                To sum it up,  MJ  took elements from all the greats before him, condensed them to one entertainer, added copious amounts of his own individualism and innovation and thereby became the man he is.
